pacman

Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • pacman.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The game panel is where the game is played. it draws the background, the points and game-characters, and reacts to the users key clicks. This class also calls the methods which move the monsters by a timer that calls the actionPerformed method and deals with encounters between pacman and the monsters.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        An array of monsters. which will be initialized in the constructor to contain two strong and two weak monsters.

        The Main frame containing this panel

      • pointMatrix

        private int[][] pointMatrix
        Matrix indicating the current state of each cell. 0 - obstacle, 1- regular point, 2 - super point, 3 - mighty point, 9 - empty cell, 8 - portal

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamePanel

        public GamePanel(Main parent)
        The constructor initializes the game. It creates monsters and pacman objects and assigns the start value to the point matrix. It creates a keyListener which sends events only for the 4 direction keys.
        Parameters:
        parent - the Main object which contains this panel.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This method is called by the timer each GAME_SPPED milliseconds. it manages the movement of monsters and pacman on the board and deals with encounters and win/lose scenarios.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • checkForCharacterEncounter

        public void checkForCharacterEncounter()
        this method checks if pacman is encountered by a monster and calls the beats method which works by the visitor pattern. it calls the relevant methods if pacman is eaten or eats.

      • cloneMatrix

        private int[][] cloneMatrix(int[][] toClone)
        A method for cloning a matrix.
        Parameters:
        toClone - the matrix to be cloned
        Returns:
        the clone.

      • getMatrix

        public int[][] getMatrix()
        a getter for the point matrix.
        Returns:
        the current point matrix

      • getPacManX

        public int getPacManX()
        the x coordination getter
        Returns:
        the x in the matrix

      • getPacManY

        public int getPacManY()
        the y coordination getter
        Returns:
        the y in the matrix

      • lose

        public void lose()
        lose scenario. stops the timer and shows the "you lose" picture.

      • moveMonsters

        private void moveMonsters()
        This method moves the monsters. it calls the move method of each monster.

      • movePacManAndCheckForDots

        private void movePacManAndCheckForDots()
        This method moves pacman and checks the cell it is currently on, if it's a special dot it turns pacman into mighty\super.

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        this method is called when the user clicks the new game button. it starts a new game by returning all characters to their starting point, sets lives back to 3 and reverts the matrix.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        The method paint draws the graphics on this panel using double buffering technique.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        graphics - is a graphics object, which the panel's graphics are edited by it.

      • paintBackground

        private void paintBackground(java.awt.Graphics g)
        this method paints the background
        Parameters:
        g - is the graphics object of this panel

      • paintGameCharacters

        private void paintGameCharacters(java.awt.Graphics g)
        this method paints the game characters. it draws each character in its current location.
        Parameters:
        g - is the graphics object of this panel

      • paintPoints

        private void paintPoints(java.awt.Graphics g)
        this method paints the points by the current state of each cell.
        Parameters:
        g - is the graphics object of this panel

      • returnToRegularPacMan

        public void returnToRegularPacMan()
        This method is called when the special pacman time turns to 0 - meaning the super/mighty pacman turns back to regular.

      • win

        public void win()
        win scenario. stops the timer and shows the victory picture.
